item.description:
During dinner in the CambridgeSide Galleria food court, we'll be making plans for the first issue of Halcyon -- a Pen & Anvil journal for literary science writing. You know the kind -- essays in the Thoreau mode, poems which take up the theme of cognition and cosmos, graceful fiction about time travelling eco-priests. Editor Nora Delaney will discuss opportunities for editorial participation, and what she's looking for from contributors.

If we have time enough, and we should, we'll also be doing our usual workshop discussion of recent writing.

After our meal, we'll walk over -- at around 7:15 -- to the nearby Museum of Science for a free film screening at 8 PM of "Adrenaline Rush: The Science of Risk. Details at http://mos.org/events....
item.how_to_find_us: We'll use cell phones to find each other
item.name: A Literary Science Evening: Dinner, Movie, Discussion
